intro: Cleome rubella, commonly known as red cleome, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is characterized by its branched stems and clusters of small, showy flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 feet and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Cleome rubella is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton.
